content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here is an example of how you can accomplish this in Julia using Regex:

```julia
using REGEX

function q_and_a_extractor(md)
    question = match(r"# Question\n([^\n]+)", md).captures[1]
    answer = match(r"# Answer\n([^\n]+)", md).captures[1]
    return (strip(question), strip(answer))
end
```
This function uses the `match` function to find both the question and answer in the markdown string, capturing the text after `# Question` and `# Answer`. The `captures` field of the returned match object is a tuple containing all captured substrings. 

The `[^\n]+` part of the regex matches any character that is not a newline (thus, it will stop at the next newline). Finally, `strip(question)` and `strip(answer)` are used to remove leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.
